customize.text:
500 years ago, a
occurred in Khaenri'ah, as a result of which Natlan faced the Abyss — a black wave that swallowed the entire world. These monsters could not be understood, and it was impossible to negotiate with them. Where children once played, laughing in gardens, now only ashes and bones burned by wildfire remained. In hot springs, now fresh blood and mud ran over the banks. According to legend, the ancient Python King of Ochkanatlan once built a skyship and forged the
— a secret treasure capable of repelling the Abyss and finally banishing it from the world. It was akin to a golden wheel that could reverse time's flow, burning away the writhing agonizing present and bringing the beautiful past back. And this treasure could only be obtained in the depths of Ochkanatlan, flooded with filth. People who had given up on fighting the Abyss decided to try their luck and go in search of the Jade, even if it was a trap. When Natlan was overrun by corruption, an evil dragon appeared in the Cinder City. All the adventurers who went in hopes of destroying the Abyss were defeated by the dragon, and almost none of them returned. Among these adventurers was a group that set out for the city in the clouds ten years after the Cataclysm. The group's leader was the most powerful warrior of the Flower-Feather Clan, Taika. Before the Cataclysm, he had always won in combat duels and was bored, thinking that his whole life would pass like this. It was only after witnessing true war that he first felt the weight of destiny. Thus did he bid his wife and unborn child farewell and set out to drive the evil spirits away. In the city, he discovered the blueprints of Ochkanatlan, thanks to which the group was able to find the Altar of Primal Fire and reach the flying ship. But the battle on the Tonatiuh was his last, and before his death, he remembered the words he said to his he said to his beloved wife as they parted.
<color=#ffffffd9>"...If it's a girl, call her Bona. She will surely become an outstanding warrior."</color>

When the adventurer and Taika's daughter, Bona, grew up, she decided to continue her father's work and secretly traveled to the ancient city to find the Jade of Return. Even if the threat from the Abyss had weakened compared to the time of her birth, she still wanted to finish the job and solve her father's final mystery. While fleeing from the evil dragon, she discovered the Core of Chu'ulel, which was once the heart of the entire city. With the Pyrophosphorite, Bona awakened the dragon spirit sleeping in the heart of the mechanism and named it Cocouik. Using the marks left by Taika's group, Bona and Cocouik reached the Altar of the Primal Fire, from which one could ascend to the Tonatiuh. Once on the ship, she discovered a large amount of Pyrophosphorite, although she thought that hers was the last on earth. Someone had taken it from the skyship and given it to all the adventurers before Bona. With Cocouik's help, the girl finally understood the true nature of the Jade of Return: there was no treasure that could destroy the Abyss, and the Jade was just a legend concocted by the Sage of the Stolen Flame to lure adventurers. The
was part of a mechanism that could save Natlan but destroy the people. Realizing the Sage's plan, Bona vowed to protect the Golden Entreaty and the last Pyrophosphorite from the Sage of the Stolen Flame and to not allow his plan to come to fruition. She stopped him, but at the cost of her life, and even Cocouik could not save her. After her death, Bona's soul remained in Ochkanatlan with Cocouik, seemingly unaware she had met her demise hundreds of years ago. customize.text:
When the Traveler, Paimon, and their Tepetlisaurus companion traveled to Ochkanatlan to seek a
a pilgrimage to the Great Volcano of Tollan, they were attacked by an evil dragon and the Abyssal monsters, but were saved by a mysterious golden glow that locked the door of the tower and separated them from the monsters. In the tower, they discovered the notes of the adventurer Bona, which she left behind during her journey to the forbidden city, and soon they met Bona herself, who remained in the city as a ghost, and Cocouik, who saved them from the monsters. Neither Bona nor the Traveler knew that the girl was dead, so they decided to join forces and search for the Jade of Return.

When the Traveler, Paimon, Tepetlisaurus, Bona, and Cocouik reached the Tonatiuh and received the Jade of Return by placing the Pyrophosphorite at the Altar of Primal Fire, Bona suddenly remembered that she had already been on the skyship and was about to destroy the Jade of Return so that it would not fall into the hands of the Sage of the Stolen Flame. The girl remembered her death and the trap left at the Golden Entreaty. Suddenly, an evil dragon appeared in the sky, snatched the Golden Entreaty, and flew away. After a chase, it turned out that the evil dragon was the body of the Python King, Och-Kan, corrupted by the Abyss. His
was finally able to reunite with his body and shared the memories with the Traveler of meeting the adventurers, his journey with Bona, and the plan of the Sage of the Stolen Flame. When the Traveler and Paimon returned to the Tonatiuh, Bona had already disappeared, and all that was left of her were her goggles. Although she was unable to complete the story in life, she sacrificed herself to prevent the Sage of the Stolen Flame from obtaining the Golden Entreaty. Bona dreamed of becoming a great adventurer, and the Traveler and Paimon promised to tell everyone about her fate and what happened on the Tonatiuh. When the souls of Cocouik and Bona returned to the Night Kingdom, they helped the Traveler face the Abyss to save all of Natlan.
